event.title: THE HISTORY BOOK CLUB - THE DAY OF THE SCORPION
event.description:
This event notification is for our next World History selection which focuses on India -- The Day of the Scorpion - Book Two of the Raj Quartet by Paul Scott beginning June 16, 2014.

This book can count as another selection in the Exotic Book Cavalcade to Iconic India Challenge. The country of India is our focus. The HBC will be reading and discussing in order all of the books which make up the Raj Quartet plus one. This is the second book in the series. The first book's threads are still up and can be accessed and you can begin reading the previous selection at any time.

No set of novels so richly recreates the last days of India under British rule--"two nations locked in an imperial embrace"--as Paul Scott's historical tour de force, " The Raj Quartet."

In The Day of the Scorpion, Scott draws us deeper in to his epic of India at the close of World War II. With force and subtlety, he recreates both private ambition and perversity, and the politics of an entire subcontinent at a turning point in history.

Reviews

“A mighty literary experience.”
—The Times

“Quite simply, monumental.”
—Washington Post

About the Author:

Paul Scott (1920-78), born in London, held a commission in the Indian army during World War II. His many novels include Johnnie Sabib, The Chinese Love Pavilion, and Staying On.

Here is the Table of Contents and Syllabus.

Bentley hopes you can join us for this World History discussion from June 16th through October 5th. An Historical Fiction offering and Jill Hutchinson will be moderating

event.title: THE HISTORY BOOK CLUB - HANNS AND RUDOLF: THE TRUE STORY OF THE GERMAN JEW WHO TRACKED DOWN AND CAUGHT THE KOMMANDANT OF AUSCHWITZ
event.description:
This event notification is for our SPOTLIGHTED book discussion selection titled Hanns and Rudolf: The True Story of the German Jew Who Tracked Down and Caught the Kommandant of Auschwitz by Thomas Hardy beginning May 12, 2014.

The discussion begins May 12, 2014 and runs through the end of August.

Here is the link to the discussion:
TBD

Synopsis:

The untold story of the man who brought a mastermind of the final solution to justice.

May 1945. In the aftermath of the Second Word War, the first British War Crimes Investigation Team is assembled to hunt down the senior Nazi officials responsible for the greatest atrocities the world has ever seen. One of the lead investigators is Lieutenant Hanns Alexander, a German Jew who is now serving in the British Army. Rudolf Höss is his most elusive target.

Hanns and Rudolf reveals for the very first time the full, exhilarating account of Höss’s capture, an encounter with repercussions that echo to this day. Moving from the Middle Eastern campaigns of the First World War to bohemian Berlin in the 1920s to the horror of the concentration camps and the trials in Belsen and Nuremberg, it tells the story of two German men- one Jewish, one Catholic- whose lives diverged, and intersected, in an astonishing way.

About the Author:

Thomas Harding is a former documentary filmmaker and journalist who has written for the Financial Times and The Guardian, among other publications. He founded a television station in Oxford, England, and for many years was an award-winning publisher of a newspaper in West Virginia. Hanns and Rudolf is his first book. He lives in Hampshire, England.

Reviews:

"Fascinating and moving...This is a remarkable book, which deserves a wide readership." (Max Hastings The Sunday Times)

"Written with admirable restraint... [Hanns and Rudolf] fascinates and shocks." (Evan Thomas Washington Post)

Bentley is the moderator and hopes you can join us for this exciting discussion.

event.title: THE HISTORY BOOK CLUB - LANDSLIDE: LYNDON JOHNSON, RONALD REAGAN, AND THE DISMANTLING OF MODERN AMERICAN POLITICS
event.description:
NOTE: THIS IS A RANDOM HOUSE OFFERING - DATES MAY BE MODIFIED BASED UPON THE RELEASE DATE - THIS IS OUR ESTIMATE AT THIS POINT IN TIME. THE AUTHOR WILL BE JOINING US FOR THIS DISCUSSION.

This event notification is for our SPOTLIGHTED book discussion selection titled Landslide: Lyndon Johnson, Ronald Reagan, and the Dismantling of Modern American Politics by Jonathan Darman beginning September 8, 2014.

The discussion begins September 8th, 2014 and runs through December. Bentley will be moderating this selection.

Here is the link to the discussion:
https://www.goodreads.com/topic/group...

Synopsis:

This book is a riveting work of narrative nonfiction that tells the story of how LBJ and Reagan transformed American politics into a contest between warring fantasies of the future in the span of a thousand days. Historians such as Jon Meacham and Evan Thomas are already raving about this one and Jonathan Darman is a newcomer to keep our eye on!

About the Author:

Jonathan Darman is a former political reporter for Newsweek, where he covered numerous campaigns including John Kerry's run in 2004 and Hillary Clinton's in 2008. He lives in New York City. His forthcoming book, Landslide: LBJ and Ronald Reagan at the Dawn of a New America , is his first.

Here is a very interesting recent article by the author:

http://www.biographile.com/the-troubl...

Bentley hopes you can join us for this exciting discussion.

event.title: THE HISTORY BOOK CLUB - THE JEWEL IN THE CROWN
event.description:
This event notification is for our next World History selection which focuses on India -- The Jewel in the Crown - Book One of the Raj Quartet by Paul Scott beginning September 16, 2013.

This book can count as one selection in the Exotic Book Cavalcade to Iconic India Challenge beginning October 1st. The country of India is our focus. The HBC will be reading and discussing in order all of the books which make up the Raj Quartet plus one.

No set of novels so richly recreates the last days of India under British rule--"two nations locked in an imperial embrace"--as Paul Scott's historical tour de force, " The Raj Quartet." "The Jewel in the Crown" opens in 1942 as the British fear both Japanese invasion and Indian demands for independence. On the night after the Indian Congress Party votes to support Gandhi, riots break out and an ambitious police sargeant arrests a young Indian for the alleged rape of the woman they both love

Reviews

“A mighty literary experience.”
—The Times

“Quite simply, monumental.”
—Washington Post

About the Author:

Paul Scott (1920-78), born in London, held a commission in the Indian army during World War II. His many novels include Johnnie Sabib, The Chinese Love Pavilion, and Staying On.

Here is the Table of Contents and Syllabus.

Bentley hopes you can join us for this World History discussion from September 16th through December 14th. An Historical Fiction offering and Jill Hutchinson will be moderating

event.title: Book Blasts & Blog Tours Hosted by I Am A Reader, Not A Writer
event.description:
Book Blasts & Blog Tours Hosted by I Am A Reader, Not A Writer

I am currently looking for book bloggers who would be willing to host for my blog tours. You receive an ebook copy of the book to review or you can put up an author interview or guest post.

You simply pick a date you can post on and then put up a blog post on that date. Simple!!

I provide HTML code to make it easy to get a post up. Most tours also include a shared rafflecopter giveaway you can include with your post.

http://bookblastpromotions.blogspot.com/

event.title: KILL MARY JANE DOE, SALE
event.description:
A Psychological Thriller
Haunted mind, marked body, beautiful woman.
All the cards stack up against Mary Jane Doe. Mary Jane is being tracked by Beasley a psychopath, a man who believes he owns her. Trapped in no where Arizona, Mary Jane must find a way out before the untouchable Beasley and his goons take her down. Her only seed of hope comes in unlocking the key to her self-identity. Then an unlikely savior comes to her aid. Can the handsome stranger be trusted? Or will they Kill Mary Jane Doe?

Take this ride for $.99!!! This sell won't last long...

amazon http://www.amazon.com/Kill-Mary-Jane-...



Coming soon to Nook and Kobo

event.title: Virtual Guest Author Book Discussion - GOING OVER with BETH KEPHART
event.venue: YA Reads for Teachers (And Any Other Adults!) Online
event.description:
Announcing June's guest author, Beth Kephart, author of Going Over!

Beth will be a guest author later this year but we are doing this special ARC giveaway to help promote her wonderful work (and to try something new)!

In order to stimulate discussion CHRONICLE BOOKS is offering 10 - 15 FREE copies of GOING OVER to YA Reads for Teachers (And Any Other Adults!) members (US ONLY)!

Here is the Goodreads book summary:

In the early 1980s Ada and Stefan are young, would-be lovers living on opposite sides of the Berlin Wall--Ada lives with her mother and grandmother and paints graffiti on the Wall, and Stefan lives with his grandmother in the East and dreams of escaping to the West.

Take some time to poke around Beth Kephart's blog http://www.beth-kephart.blogspot.com/ to learn more about her and her work.

There's also a really great video and common core aligned teacher materials: http://beth-kephart.blogspot.com/p/we...

REVIEWS

A Junior Library Guild Selection!
A School Library Journal Pick of the Day

“A stark reminder of the power of hope, courage, and love.”—Booklist, starred review

"An excellent example of historical fiction focusing on an unusual time period."—School Library Journal, starred review

"Life in the grim shadow of the Berlin Wall is vividly reflected in Kephart’s moving exploration in two voices." — Kirkus

If you'd like to win a copy of GOING OVER be one of the first 7 people to reply to this message that you'll attend the online book discussion with Beth in June.

NOTE: In exchange for the FREE book it is expected that you'll either blog about the book or write a review and post it to Goodreads before the end of April!

Only Everything is the story of a female teeanage Cupid who is banished to Earth and must match three couples without her powers in order to save the love of her life from the wrath of the Gods.

The party will include a dramatic reading from Only Everything, a Q&A with the authors, a book sale and much more. BE THERE!

event.title: Lady's Destiny Tour Sign-up
event.description:
Enticing Journey would like to invite you to take part in the blog tour for A.R. Von's Adult Fantasy Romance novel, Lady's Destiny running May 5-16th with multiple stops per day. This does NOT have to be top post and ARCs will be available soon. If you are requesting a mobi copy for review please make sure to add Enticingjourney@gmail.com to your approved document list and provide me with your @kindle.com email address. The blog package will be sent 7-10 days prior to the start of the tour.
* Required
Lady's Destiny on Goodreads: https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/2...

Lady's Destiny Synopsis:
When dreams haunt you in the most delicious ways and fate pulls you into destiny’s path, what can be done other than to accept and submit to it.

Can Iria truly get what she’s always dreamed of or will it always just remain a memory? Being a rare creature such as her with exceptional beauty and rarity of existence should be enough. Though, all she wants is her desire, her destiny… To be with a man—one man.

Are these dreams she’s having real? Could she really take on human form and become a Lady to be with the man she craves?

Dezso discovers a magical creature—a being of incredible light and peace. He is drawn to it again and again, and his feelings grow with every encounter. He carries a dark secret that he wishes never existed. The only thing that truly brings light upon his existence is the beauty that warms his heart but seems to only exist in his head—with dreams and visions of a magical woman, full of heartwarming light.

Will he ever know true love and happiness? Will he ever be able to lighten the weight and share his dark secret with another...?

Darkness is growing stronger, weakening the light and killing off what makes the world a beautiful place to live in. Enter a world of fantasy and dreams, passions and temptations. A world where dragons, unicorns, magic and mermaids really do exist. A world where love WILL conquer all!

event.title: Kindle Fire Giveaway with Gina Whitney
event.description: Enter for a chance to win a New Kindle Fire HD, $75 Amazon Gift Card PLUS Saving Abel and Beautiful Lies Swag from Gina Whitney. All you have to do is post a legit review of Beautiful Lies on Amazon & Goodreads!!

event.title: Honest Reviews of 8+ Christian Books Needed
event.description:
My name is Guy Stanton III and I'm an author, who writes from a Christian's perspective. I've come to the literary world only recently, but I've been writing for some time and now all of my books are beginning to see the screens of Kindles and Nooks everywhere, but they need help to get there, your help dear Reader. I'm offering all of my books for free, but there is one stipulation. I need honest quality reviews placed on any and as many of the following: Amazon, Barns&Noble, Smashwords, Goodreads, personal blogs, and any other social media that's relevant. Here's the deal, I have two series to date, The Warrior Kind (Epic Fantasy / Science Fiction) and The Agents for Good (Romance Thriller/Action Adventure). A total of eight books, with more coming as I get them final edited. I have made my two series starter books, A Warrior's Redemption and Agent with a History, permanently free at all of the following online locations: Goodreads, PublicBookshelf, Free-ebooks.net, and Smashwords. Download them at your pleasure and if you like what you read then leave a review at any of the aforementioned places and let me know about it via Goodreads message system. In your message show me proof of a review and I will send you the next book in that series for free. Please also list your email and what format you would like the additional free books to be in. I can handle the following format requests at present: Kindle, ePub, and PDF. If you like and review the second book of the series and send me proof of it then I'll send you the third book of the series and so on and so on. This free promotional event will last to the end of March 2014, however I may continue to send my newly released books, as they come available well into the future, to particular reviewers, who catch my eye with their insightful and well written reviews of my literary work. To learn more about me, what I write, and why I write, feel free to check out my website, www.words-of-action.com
- Best Regards Everyone and a Happy New Year!

event.title: "The Guild of Assassins" Book Release
event.description:
Kara has achieved something that no Majat has ever managed – freedom from the Guild!

But the Black Diamond assassin Mai has been called back to face his punishment for sparing her life. Determined to join his fight or share his punishment, Kara finds herself falling for Mai.

But is their relationship – and the force that makes their union all-powerful – a tool to defeat the overpowering forces of the Kaddim armies, or a distraction sure to cause the downfall of the Majat?

event.title: I NEED YOUR CANDID REVIEW
event.description:
My name is Tekin Bora, an author from a small Mediterranean town. I tried to share through my debut novel Aquarian the little-known, crucial effects of water on health, mind and body as pointed out by Jesus himself and the Man Carrying a Water Jug who is also mentioned in the Holy Bible. I want to share this crucial information with as many people as possible. That's why I need your help through candid reviews to be posted on Amazon, goodreads, personal blogs and twitter accounts.

If you agree to participate, I'll send you a copy of my e-book and when you send me a proof of your review posted onto any aforementioned sites through Goodreads message system, I will send you the next book in this series for free. Plus you can also attend my book question contest to win a free holiday to Italy this summer. Remember: no quota on the number of winners, only the correct answer matters. Currently over 30 people are attending my contest at https://www.goodreads.com/event/show/...

Thank you for your kind attention!

event.title: Goodreads Giveaway -- A new murder mystery -- WHO KILLED 'TOM JONES'?
event.description:

Enter thru 1/20.

This book giveaway is open to members in only the following countries: US.

event.title: 99 cent sale for Life, Love, and Surviving High School!
event.description:
Life, Love, and Surviving High School is on sale for only 99 cents!
http://amzn.com/B00I5N05M2
Claire makes an offer about Brent that Becca can't resist....

Becca's in high school, but she hasn't been on the same page as her best friends since just before the start of middle school and she doesn't know exactly how things got so different. Not different in some edgy, gritty, she's-a-rebel way. More of a Yes-she's-a-dork way. Which makes it all the more amazing that while other friendships have crashed and burned all around them the four of girls have managed to stay Best Friends Forever. She doesn't need to share in her friends' spotlight. Becca's happy to follow along in the shadows, as long as she's not totally cast aside.

She's definitely not ready for guys. In fact, she just wants to skip right over high school and jump straight to twenty-two. By then she figures she will have gotten through her first date, first kiss, passed her driver's test, taken the SATs, filled out all those college applications, somehow survived living in a dorm and gotten her college degree without all the anxiety and drama.

Instead, just after silently deciding to not even think about guys and concentrate on school work for the next four years, she is instantly mesmerized by Brent, a seriously great-looking senior who also happens to have a long-time girlfriend, Claire. Not one to be the "other woman," Becca imagines creative ways for Claire to be out of Brent's life.

Meanwhile, Becca forms a strictly friends-only relationship with Colt. Becca and Colt turn out be good partners when it comes to studying, taking pictures for the school newspaper and working on a term paper together.

But when one day Claire makes an offer about Brent that Becca can't resist, that changes everything.

event.title: GIVEAWAY: The Summer I Wasn't Me
event.description: Stop by my blog to read a guest post from Jessica Verdi, read my review, and enter to win a copy of The Summer I Wasn't Me.

event.title: THE SOUL AWAKENING TELESUMMIT
event.description:
FREE 3-day Online Event (6th, 7th, & 8th of May at 12 - 1:30pm Pacific on each day). For full details and sign-up: http://bit.ly/1hzJqvP

The 'Soul Awakening' telesummit with over 4 hours of inspiration and information from 11 world-class speakers discussing connection, aliveness and living a meaningful life. Hosted by global psychologist Milan Ljubincic, and co-host Lynn Serafinn, with special guests including Dr. Eric Pearl, Chloe Taylor Brown, Gregg Levoy, Karen Erlichman, Emmanuel Dagher, Cari Murphy, Frederika Roberts, Wendy Kennedy, and Anna Sienicka.

*If you are not able to attend the live event, register anyway to listen to the recording.

event.title: Now Available: Teen Spirit Guide to Modern Shamanism!!
event.description: With a foreward by Sandra Ingerman, "Teen Spirit Guide to Modern Shamanism" is a light-hearted and informative handbook introducing an ancient spiritual practice to today's young adults and beginning seekers. Modern shaman and author S. Kelley Harrell, gives insight into growing from an intuitive youth into a mature facilitator of healing for others, covering the history and roles of the shaman, and their relevance in our shifting times. Complete with instructions on ecstatic journeying, this guide also presents how to incorporate shamanic insights into daily life, and how to talk with others about the modern shamanic path.

event.title: Enthrall Her - May 20th - Novel Celebration Release Day!
event.description:
Enthrall Her is the second book in Vanessa's erotic romance trilogy.

Join us on the book tour here on Goodreads as well as Facebook and twitter.

Come celebrate the release of Enthrall Her, alongside all the amazing book bloggers and reviewers.

We look forward to seeing you!

event.title: Author Talk with Nick Mann
event.description:
Dr. Benjamin Parks, the main character of Nick Mann's 2013 novel, Forgetful, seems to be thriving. But his professional success as a consultant and Howard University instructor is complicated by his personal life. His marriage is strained, and he fears he may be developing symptoms of dementia. How will he cope with these challenges? And how will they transform him?

Join us at the Deanwood Neighborhood Library on Saturday, May 10, at 2 p.m. for an author talk with the locally-based Dr. Mann, who will read from Forgetful and discuss its themes and local setting, as well as the process of writing and publishing the novel and the role his own professional experiences as an organization development practitioner and Federal Executive Institute adjunct faculty member play in his work.

Copies of the novel will be available for check out, purchase and signing.

If you haven't been to the Deanwood Library before, it has ample parking both in a parking lot and onstreet, plus it is located mere steps away from the Deanwood metro stop on the orange line.

event.title: Tanabata Challenge
event.description: In honor of the star-crossed summertime festival, we are reading astrological based and themed books for our own festival. Please join us in the Tanabata Challenge, and maybe your dreams will come true.

event.title: Famous in a Small Town (An Entering Southern Country Novel) eBook Free
event.description:
Famous in a Small Town (An Entering Southern Country Novel) Kindle edition will be free on 5/07/2014 through 5/11/2014 at Amazon.com
Famous in a Small Town is a southern mystery thriller. A sample reading is available at Amazon to help you decide if this book is right for you. Please feel free to pass this along to your friends.
You can view the book trailer (2nd video listed) on my Goodreads author page. https://www.goodreads.com/author/show...
Thank you for your support.
Happy reading!
Famous in a Small Town (An Entering Southern Country Novel)
The quiet town of Cypress, Mississippi is turned upside down when a former citizen, Raven Sawyer, returns for a funeral. Raven’s fictional novel goes viral when the town folk realize that she’s the author, and soon they’re thinking that her book is not fiction but truth. Every little dirty detail is revealed in her book and has the people of Cypress wagging their tongues and shaking their heads at a few of the upper-class citizens and—the Sheriff.
All Raven wants is to get through the funeral and go back to New York, but Sheriff Cal Rayburn can’t allow her to leave after she discovers and turns over evidence that may be connected to a double homicide that he’s investigating. At least, that’s the excuse he’s giving her, and he’ll go to any length to keep her in Cypress until he can make her believe that the affair, that she thinks he had six years ago, never happened.
When more dead bodies turn up, Cal feels they’re connected to the double homicide, but with the evidence he has, he can’t make a connection. He’s left with more questions than answers. He’s told that Raven’s novel may have answers to questions that could help with his investigation, but what it reveals is more than what he wants to know.
Famous in a Small Town is book one of An Entering Southern Country Novel trilogy. It has murder, lies, fiction, and truth—and more twists and turns than the back roads of northwestern Mississippi. Enter at your own risk.

event.address: 365 Fifth Avenue at The Elebash Recital Hall – On the main floor of the building and on the left as you enter into the main lobb
event.title: Whiz Kid Turns to Fizz and Then Sees The Light - With Peter Grandich
event.description:
You are cordially invited on behalf of the Financial Policy Council’s Board of Directors http://www.financialpolicycouncil.org..., to our next Financial Policy Council private briefing with Mr. Peter Grandich, Financier, Entrepreneur and Wealth Creator.

Bio: Though he never finished high school, Peter Grandich entered Wall Street in the mid-1980s with no formal education or training and within three years was appointed Vice President of Investment Strategy for a leading New York Stock Exchange member firm. He would go on to hold positions as a Market Strategist, portfolio manager for four hedge funds and a mutual fund that bore his name.

His abilities has resulted in hundreds of media interviews including Good Morning America, Neil Cavuto’s Your World on Fox News, The Kudlow Report on CNBC, Wall Street Journal, Barron’s, Financial Post, Globe and Mail, US News & World Report, New York Times, Business Week, MarketWatch, Business News Network and dozens more. He’s spoken at investment conferences around the globe, edited numerous investment newsletters, and is one of the more sought after commentators.

He is the also the founder of Trinity Financial Sports & Entertainment Management Co., a firm with a Christian perspective which he started in 2001 with former NY Giant and two-time Super Bowl champion Lee Rouson. The firm offers services to celebrities, athletes and average folks. Peter Grandich is a member of the National Association of Christian Financial Consultants, and a long-standing member of The New York Society of Security Analysts and The Society of Quantitative Analysts.

He released his autobiography, Confessions of a Wall Street Whiz Kid, in the Fall of 2011. The book is available on Amazon.com. For more information, visit the book’s website is www.ConfessionsOfaWallStreetWhizKid.com

Business Attire please.

event.title: [Sign Ups] Benton: A Zombie Novel Blitz
event.description:
If you have a website, blog, or simply use Facebook, you can share the book information on one of the designated days.



*There will be a blitz- wide Rafflecopter giveaway
*Bloggers get Rafflecopter option for blitz giveaway
*hosts gain entry to host giveaway
*post on any day during the blitz
*Premade HMTL post available
*Use Facebook banner to spread the word!


[Blurb is being redone for the blitz. I will send out the new blurb with blitz info] The zombie apocalypse has come to Waterbank, Illinois, and 23-year-old Jennifer Benton is the sole survivor of the Benton home. Holed up in her bedroom, she knows the only way to live is to escape. But zombies aren't the only things she has to navigate. The humans she meets along the way are a varied group. Some have good intentions, but others not so much. Follow Jennifer as she deals with zombies, humans, and falling in love. Benton is a romance/zombie apocalypse/new-adult book set to be published June 1, 2014.

event.title: Book launch
event.description:
Guitarist/singer Ken Curtis joins Jerry Peterson for the launch of "Capitol Crime", the second book in his Wings Over the Mountains series. It's 1933. Prohibition is still on. Is it possible that an illegal whiskey business so large that it can supply half the state of Tennessee have anything to do with the brutal murder of a farm family that Sheriff Quill Rose is investigating? Rose doesn’t think so until he hijacks a series of tanker trucks hauling the illegal booze–to get a line on the money men intent on racking up big profits from Prohibition–and the murderer comes after him.

One scene in "Capitol Crime" takes place at The Grand Ole Opry. As a tip of the hat to the Opry, Curtis will play and sing "The Wabash Cannonball", the song country performer Ray Acuff made famous.

event.title: Book Expo America
event.description: ERAMANE will be featured in two booths at the Book Expo America. I will be there too! I might be signing, but it hasn't been finalized.

event.title: Teaching: Fiction-Creative nonfiction writing workshop
event.description:
Edgartown (Martha's Vineyard) MA
August 10-August 16
Teaching a fiction and creative nonfiction writing workshop
Noepe Center For Literary Arts, 104 Main Street, Edgartown (Martha's Vineyard), Ma 02539
for details click on: http://noepecenter.org/nahid-rachin-f...
for accommodation click on: http://writersresidency.com/marthas-v...
For questions contact: Justen Ahren at: noepecenter@?gmail.com or: nahidr@?rcn.com
One of New England’s most elegant communities, Edgartown (Martha's Vineyard) was the Island’s first colonial settlement and it has been the county seat since 1642. Main Street in Edgartown is a picture-book setting with its harbor and waterfront. The tall square-rigged ships that sailed all the world’s oceans have passed from the Edgartown scene, but the heritage of those vessels and their captains has continued.

event.title: Blog Tour Synchrony by Cindy Ray Hale
event.description:

There will be a tour wide giveaway.

If you are interested in participating, you can sign-up here: http://www.lolasblogtours.net/blog-to...

event.title: Greater Rochester Teen Book Festival
event.description: The Ninth Annual Greater Rochester Teen Book Festival is FREE and open to everyone, but seating preference will be given to teen readers at all sessions! No registration is needed...just come and enjoy the day!

event.title: A River of One's Own: 17th Annual River Writing Journey for Women
event.description: This six-day rafting adventure, "A RIVER OF ONE’S OWN: A HEROINE'S JOURNEY INTO THE WORLD OF STORY" features actress and playwright Ellen McLaughlin as Page Lambert’s special guest. Professionally outfitted by Sheri Griffith Expeditions, you’ll float down the Colorado River, past the confluence of the Green River, through beautiful Cataract Canyon to Lake Powell. The trip culminates with a breathtaking scenic flight from Lake Powell back to Moab. SGE provides everything—rafts, tents, sleeping bags, fresh healthy meals, etc. The fabulous women guides do all the cooking and rowing—you get to relax, enjoy the scenery, journal, and circle up each night for inspiring campfire talks under the stars. This will be Page's 17th river writing journey for women with SGE, which were featured in Oprah’s O magazine in 2006 as “One of the top six great, all-girl getaways of the year!” $1725 includes scenic flight. $300 deposit holds your space. The trip starts and ends in Moab, Utah.

Books To Go Now is actively acquiring works (from short stories to full novel length) from both aspiring and established authors. Before submitting a query or proposal, please read the guidelines below. Please don’t hesitate to contact us at inquiry@bookstogonow.com if you have questions.

event.description:

event.title: Glimpse of Darkness - Ebook Free
event.description:
******FREE EBOOK EDITION*********

Charlene (Charlie) Bennett is a simple waitress in the wilds of Hyder, Alaska whose father has just gone missing. Isolated and alone, her fathers’ disappearance is nothing new to her, but this time things are a little different.

For starters, there is a handsome stranger, Daniel that has come to town and while Charlie has never taken more than a passing interest in strangers, she has an immediate and intense attraction to this one. Secondly, she’s soon to find out that this stranger isn’t what he appears. He’s about to throw Charlie’s entire world into a major upheaval.

Now Charlie has to decide if she believes this strangers’ incredible story and follow Daniel or if she wants to stay in the only home she’s ever known for an uncertain future and an absentee father. As she comes to terms with what Daniel shows her, she realizes that he’s the only true thing in her life and leaves everything she knows behind to follow the handsome stranger.

event.title: Nominate Your Favorite Books for the CWR Summer Reading Challenge
event.description:
The CurvyWriter Blog & Radio Show is hosting a Summer Reading Challenge that will run from June through August. The Rules for the Challenge will be announced in more detail later.

BUT FIRST....YOU MUST NOMINATE YOUR FAVORITE BOOKS!

Yes, YOU THE READER gets to nominate the books that will be in the challenge. Keep reading for details and links to the nomination form!
(DON'T FORGET TO INVITE ALL OF YOUR FRIENDS TO JOIN IN AS WELL!)

NOMINATIONS RUN FROM NOW UNTIL MAY 31!!!

http://curvywriter.info/curvywriter-s...

STAGE ONE: NOMINATIONS

Readers nominate one book in each genre.
At the end of nominations the votes will be tallied
The three books in each category with the most nominations will be listed as Challenge Books.
The Authors of the top three nominated books in each category will get “Summer Reading Challenge Nominated Book”
The book in each category with the MOST nominations will be designated as a *CurvyWriter Blog Certified Recommended Summer Read* and the authors will receive graphics to display.
All nominated books will be listed in a blog post on The CurvyWriter Blog

http://curvywriter.info/curvywriter-s...

event.title: Marty McFly Spotters Club
event.description: Next year is 2015, and we should start planning now if we want to organize a group outing to Hill Valley, California. Marty McFly is due to arrive from 1985 in the next year, so we'll all need to converge on Hill Valley and set up monitoring near the clock tower.

event.description: June 1, also the sacred day of the goddess Juno, is the son of Zeus, Jason Grace's birthday. Come celebrate it with us!

event.title: DEBAUCHED IN DIAMONDS, Tulle & Tulips 4 Releases
event.description: If you’re opposed to a man who forgets to clean and a woman willing to tolerate his quirks… Wait, isn’t that that’s real life?

event.title: FIERY, Whispering Cove 4 Releases
event.description:
The one way they don’t rub each other wrong is in each other’s arms.


Carmen Smith’s artist’s eye saw inspiration wherever she glanced as soon as she set foot on the cobbled streets of Whispering Cove, and among the inspiration she’s found the slower pace she always hoped for.

But as warm as her new life is, she harbors a secret dream to find a man who sees her as an equal and who loves her for who she is, rather than out of charity. The man she’s been partnered with to re-design the town square gets her fired up—but not in a way she expected.

Ryan Alden gave up his military career to help his father with the family business. He’s accepted his place in Whispering Cove, but still feels like an outsider at times. When he meets the bombshell babe with a vintage flare who challenges him like no other, he glimpses the life he has always longed for—but not in a way he anticipated.

From the get-go, they clash like oil and watercolor. And a relationship that looked good on paper might not be the right composition at all…

Colleen Houck recently announced the forthcoming publication of a prequel to the Tiger’s Curse Series! The novella is set to publish on June 1 and is called Tiger’s Promise.

At this time, we’re happy to announce that the e-book may be pre-ordered on Amazon.com and Amazon.ca here: http://amzn.to/1kMZ8Lo

Colleen is also hoping to collect questions from fans for an exclusive Q&A video this spring. To add yours, simply post a comment at the end of her blog post here: http://bit.ly/1fUmIUq

We hope that you are as excited as we are for the release of Tiger’s Promise! Please let us know if you have any questions.

event.title: Indie Romance Conveniton
event.description:
Theme for 2014 is “The Roaring Indies”

Where: Lebanon Tennessee, Lebanon Woolen Mills

Venue

Lebanon Woolen Mills is walking distance from downtown Lebanon’s historical square. The original Mill officially closed its doors in 1998. A visionary developer took on the task of creating a place to host different events. This unique space is perfect for our Indie Romance Convention 2014.

Sammy B’s, a fantastic restaurant and bar, is located just inside the Mill. You don’t want to miss shopping and sightseeing at the antique shop

and boutiques in Lebanon’s historic square.

When: September 11th thru 14th, 2014

Mark your calendars now!

Who’s invited: The indie book community—readers, writers, and industry professionals

We need all of you to make this convention even better than the last.

What to expect: Bring your favorite party hat and be prepared to have a great time while making new friends and catching up with old ones.

Author and reader panels * Shopping trips with our authors * Book signing

*Special Event*

1920′s theme dinner dance with DJ

2014 convention will host 100 authors and 400 readers and indie services.

IRC hosts all walks of the romance sub-genre, from sweet romances all the way up to spank me harder romances, just as long as there’s a HEA.

Registration ends August 10, 2014.


We are also offering a writers contest, http://indieromanceconvention.blogspo...

event.title: Special Guest Author: Christopher Yates, Black Chalk
event.description:
Saturday, May 10, 2014 at 3:00 pm (pdt)

Stop in and listen to the interview with Christopher Yates, author of Black Chalk. Call in and ask questions or make comments, or talk in the Chat Room which will be available.

Toll-free number is 1-877-404-0839

Join Us!
